name: Hotel Riu Palace Pacifico

reviews.text: Don't expect a "Garden View" to actually overlook a garden, or anything green, for that matter. Our rooms looked directly into an adjoining hotel, with a dirt construction pit down below - no indication that you are at a tropical beach location. The guest rooms had poor ventilation systems, as did the public restrooms. (Upon returning home, even the clothes that weren't worn needed to be laundered because they smelled moldy.) The dining room was a zoo, with young children darting in and out of the buffet lines, and mothers trying to squeeze strollers through the closely arranged tables. Even though almost every table was still occupied at 10:30 a.m. when the breakfast buffet closed, the restaurant management turned off the lights and all of the fans to encourage the patrons to leave. Even when dining in the specialty restaurants, there is a rushed and noisy atmosphere. The quality of the food was generally good, but bar drinks were watery and inconsistent.
reviews.title: A Disappointment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the hotel management to be unresponsive to the guests' needs, and even disingenuous. At 5:30 p.m. when we still could not get into our rooms, we were given the run-around from several lower level managers. Upon requesting to speak with the hotel director, we were told that he would get in contact with us. We were finally able to get into our rooms, but the director never did contact us. Upon checkout 5 days later, we asked once more, and of course he wasn't available. After pressing, we were finally able to speak to an assistant director, who told us that she was aware of our complaints, but that "for some reason" they could not locate us during our stay (imagine a hotel not knowing which rooms their guests are in!)
reviews.title: Disneyworld in Mexico?

reviews.text: Great food at the main buffet, including made to order grilled sandwiches for breakfast and pastas for dinner. Plenty of selection and cooking stations, for fresh and warm food. Wine is by the bottle, fairly good quality - they also have sparkling wine at all bars and restaurants. A nice gentlemen plays the piano in the lobby bar before dinners. Plenty of shade by pool, best beach is at the Riu Jalisco which is a 10-minute walk by the beach. It is the best beach because it has plenty of mature palm trees and swimming in the ocean is pleasant in that area. At the Palace, there is no shade by the beach during the day, however early mornings or late afternoons by the beach don't require shade. The Riu Palace beach is still quite nice (not that huge) and it is a 1-minute walk from pool to beach.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation!

likes.liked: — Close proximity to pool, beach and restaurants
likes.disliked: — Palm trees are still too small at beach - however we knew that before we booked.

reviews.text: We were there Oct 17-24. Sunshine for the entire week, days around 35 degrees C, evenings around 25C. Extremely hot weather, however with all restaurants air conditionned and the extremely clean and large pool, this was not an issue for us. We went to the spa for a pedicure, good prices and excellent service. We had a junior suite with partial ocean view, view of courtyard and pools. Try to request a room on the opposite wing of the theater, although not extremely noisy, we could hear the evening shows from our room and we were in 4051 (with double beds).
reviews.title: Beautiful, but BEWARE!

likes.disliked: — Unwilling to respect my prior reservations - proper room given for monies paid

reviews.text: The Krystal Gourmet Restaurant was really good, different with the preparations however very tasty and original. Service at all restaurants was very good, including the buffet. Steakhouse was good, not the best ever but worth the reservation. You can make 2 a-la-carte reservations per day, for anytime during your stay. Several ate at the a-la-carte every night. We chose the buffet a few evenings as we wanted to take pictures of the sunset, which is incredible.
reviews.title: Great Trip BUT.........

likes.liked: — The waiters/waitresses and entertainment staff were awesome!
likes.disliked: — The number of kids and the fact that the management did not follow through on issues!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were some children in the pool, however they have a tendancy to stay at both ends as it is not as deep, so not an issue. Overall, an excellent vacation and I would return anyday.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect for a family vacation

likes.disliked: — The distance from the downtown area

reviews.title: 3rd RIU visit, not the best but overall nice

likes.liked: — Very clean and great introductory rates

reviews.text: Looked forward to return to one of our favorite beaches for a few days of luxury in the sun. Booked online and gave the credit card- got good rates as the hotel had just opened ($87 US per person per night). Impressive looking hotel, rooms are functional and brand new. Looked into the courtyard which was noisy (music from the shows bounces up the courtyard) but the view was better than on the north side which faced into another hotel and over top of all the air-conditioning units (also really noisy). High density but really lovely lay out in resort. Then came the scam.....
reviews.title: Wonderful beech, scammed badly and left

reviews.text: turns out the front desk couldn't find our registration at check in. I gave them a copy of all my paper work. Wasted nearly 2 hours and then "no problem" -go have dinner and we'll sort it out after. Not sorted out after dinner so said will see you in the morning. In the morning saw manager #3 who again asked for copies of our papers (emails) figured out the problem and basically said so sad where's your credit card and here's your bill for $800 US! Management saw the problem, recognized the tour company we were operating with, recognized this had happened before, and yet would not honor the rate quoted and instead said we would have to pay the rack rate of $400 per night (going up to $500 next month) and that was it. We left the hotel getting 1 night's rate credited back to our card after another hour or so at front desk.... The management there just doesn't care that it is a big deal for some of us to get down to Mexico and that a) online reservations should be honored, b) the rack rate should be disclosed before anyone gets a room key, and c) they wrecked this potentially wonderful holiday... that is a really big deal for us as we won't be down for some time again. The hotel next door was the exact opposite: simple but spacious condo rooms, clean, great pool,and very very friendly and helpful staff. It was called Playa Del Sol Grande and we were really relieved to still have the wonderful beach experience at a much more reasonable cost with good people. Great grocery store next door so we just went out for dinner and relaxed.
reviews.title: We were here for the opening.

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at this all inclusive resort for a week starting Oct. 4, one day after its’ grand opening. Overall we were very happy with our experience there. Everything was up and running. We knew we had taken a bit of chance by trying a place that may not have been fully ready, but counted on the good reputation of Riu.
reviews.title: OK, but....
